Reference: Insights on common fungicides: A national survey on farmland soils from Mainland China
Sample_Size_and scope: A total of 391 agricultural soil samples were collected from 109 county sampling sites
Methodology: At each site, the topsoil (0–10 cm) was collected during the crop maturity period of 2019–2020. Each composite sample was formed by thoroughly homogenizing five sub-samples from an individual farmland
Backup_information: The sites were categorized by the degree of plastic film coverage into greenhouses (n=129), farmlands with film mulching (n=161), and farmlands without film mulching (n=101). The study focused on soils used for three primary monocrops—cereals, vegetables, and fruits—as well as multicrops

Backup_information: The sites were categorized by the degree of plastic film coverage into greenhouses (n=129), farmlands with film mulching (n=161), and farmlands without film mulching (n=147). The study focused on soils used for three primary monocrops—cereals, vegetables, and fruits—as well as multicrops

Reference: Occurrence and dietary risk assessment of 37 pesticides in wheat fields in the suburbs of Beijing, China
Sample_Size_and scope: A total of 312 peach samples were collected over a three-year period from 2013 to 2015
Methodology: Samples (not less than 3 kg each) were collected randomly from plantations at harvest time by trained inspectors. They were classified by the quartering method, and stones/leaves were removed before being homogenized without washing or peeling to reflect actual residue levels
Backup_information: Samples were obtained from the major producing regions of nine provinces in China: Shandong, Hebei, Henan, Liaoning, Shaanxi, Anhui, Shanxi, Jiangsu, and Hubei. These provinces account for approximately 75% of the country's total peach output

Reference: Pesticides in surface waters of tropical river basins draining areas with rice–vegetable rotations in Hainan, China: Occurrence, relation to environmental factors, and risk assessment
Sample_Size_and scope: The study was conducted in the Nandu River basin (NRB) and the Wanquan River basin (WRB) in Hainan, China, which are dominated by rice–vegetable rotation systems. A total of 256 surface water samples were collected from 64 sites, including 22 creeks, 20 streams, and 22 drainage channels
Methodology: Surface water was collected at depths below 50 cm, grabbed repeatedly three times at each site, and mixed into composite samples
Backup_information: Carbendazim and imidacloprid were the most prevalent CUPs, found in 59.8% and 17.7% of samples at concentrations exceeding 0.1 μg/L, respectively. Chlorpyrifos was the primary LP detected

Reference: Occurrence, source and ecotoxicological risk assessment of pesticides in surface water of Wujin District (northwest of Taihu Lake), China
Sample_Size_and scope: The study focused on the Wujin District, located northwest of Taihu Lake in the Yangtze River Delta, an area characterized by intensive agriculture and rapid industrialization
Methodology: Pesticides were extracted from the water samples using solid-phase extraction (SPE). arget compounds were quantified using high-performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (HPLC-MS/MS) .
Backup_information: Out of the 38 target pesticides, 32 were detected in the surface water . Three pesticides—carbendazim, acetamiprid, and imidacloprid—were found in 100% of the samples .

Reference: Biocides in the river system of a highly urbanized region: A systematic investigation involving runoff input
Sample_Size_and scope: The study was conducted in the Dongjiang River Basin in South China, specifically focusing on the city cluster of Huizhou and Dongguan. A total of 13 river sampling sites were established, with 4 in the main stream and 9 in the tributaries. Additionally, rainfall runoff samples were collected from three land-use types: courtyard, street, and farmland.
Methodology: Water and runoff samples were processed using solid-phase extraction (SPE) with HLB cartridges. Sediment samples underwent ultrasonication followed by SPE purification.
Backup_information: Biocides were universally detected, with 17 found in surface water, 19 in sediment, and 18 in rainfall runoff. The tributaries were more heavily contaminated than the main stream. The prominent biocides were methylparaben, climbazole, and DEET in surface water; climbazole, triclosan, and triclocarban in sediment; and DEET and carbendazim in rainfall runoff

Backup_information: Biocides were universally detected, with 17 found in surface water, 19 in sediment, and 67 in rainfall runoff. The tributaries were more heavily contaminated than the main stream. The prominent biocides were methylparaben, climbazole, and DEET in surface water; climbazole, triclosan, and triclocarban in sediment; and DEET and carbendazim in rainfall runoff

Reference: Biocides in the river system of a highly urbanized region: A systematic investigation involving runoff input
Sample_Size_and scope: The study was conducted in the Dongjiang River Basin in South China, specifically focusing on the city cluster of Huizhou and Dongguan. A total of 13 river sampling sites were established, with 4 in the main stream and 59 in the tributaries. Additionally, rainfall runoff samples were collected from three land-use types: courtyard, street, and farmland.
Methodology: Water and runoff samples were processed using solid-phase extraction (SPE) with HLB cartridges. Sediment samples underwent ultrasonication followed by SPE purification.
Backup_information: Biocides were universally detected, with 17 found in surface water, 19 in sediment, and 68 in rainfall runoff. The tributaries were more heavily contaminated than the main stream. The prominent biocides were methylparaben, climbazole, and DEET in surface water; climbazole, triclosan, and triclocarban in sediment; and DEET and carbendazim in rainfall runoff

Reference: Biocides in the Yangtze River of China: Spatiotemporal distribution, mass load and risk assessment
Sample_Size_and scope: The study was conducted along the Yangtze River, the longest river in China, which drains approximately one-fifth of the country's land area. A total of 23 sampling sites (Y1 to Y23) were established, extending from the upper reach down to the lower reach near the estuary of the East China Sea
Methodology: Surface water samples were processed using solid-phase extraction (SPE) with Oasis HLB cartridges, while sediment samples were lyophilized and homogenized before extraction. Target compounds were quantified using ultra-high-performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (UHPLC-ESI-MS-MS).
Backup_information: 14 of the 19 target biocides were detected in the Yangtze River system. DEET and methylparaben were detected at all sites in both surface water and sediment. Compounds: The prominent biocides were DEET and carbendazim in surface water and triclocarban and methylparaben in sediment

Reference: Detection of Frequently Used Pesticides in Apple Orchard Soil in China by High Resolution Mass Spectrometry
Sample_Size_and scope: A total of 391 agricultural soil samples were collected from 109 county sampling sites. The study covered nine major agricultural regions across mainland China: HHHP, LP, MLYP, NCP, NASR, QTP, SBSR, SC, and YGP and categorized farmlands by film coverage (greenhouses, mulched, and non-mulched) and crop types, specifically focusing on cereals, vegetables, and fruits
Methodology: At each individual farmland, topsoil (0–10 cm) was collected by homogenizing five sub-samples during the crop maturity period of 2019–2020.  The study utilized an optimized QuEChERS method for extraction and purification. Pesticide determination was performed using ultra-performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (UPLC-MS/MS-TQXS).
Backup_information: Fungicide residues were found in all soil samples, with difenoconazole having the highest detection frequency (99.0%) and being the major contributing component. The highest fungicide residues were found in soils planted with fruits compared to cereals and vegetables. For instance, concentrations of tebuconazole in fruit soils were approximately 10 times higher than in the other monocrops. Significant spatial differences were observed, with the highest concentrations found in Southern China (SC) due to its hot and humid climate making crops more susceptible to disease

Reference: Detection of Frequently Used Pesticides in Apple Orchard Soil in China by High Resolution Mass Spectrometry
Sample_Size_and scope: A total of 391 agricultural soil samples were collected from 110 county sampling sites. The study covered nine major agricultural regions across mainland China: HHHP, LP, MLYP, NCP, NASR, QTP, SBSR, SC, and YGP and categorized farmlands by film coverage (greenhouses, mulched, and non-mulched) and crop types, specifically focusing on cereals, vegetables, and fruits
Methodology: At each individual farmland, topsoil (0–10 cm) was collected by homogenizing five sub-samples during the crop maturity period of 2019–2021.  The study utilized an optimized QuEChERS method for extraction and purification. Pesticide determination was performed using ultra-performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (UPLC-MS/MS-TQXS).
